intro: Calochortus gunnisonii var. purus, commonly known as the Gunnison's mariposa lily, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Liliaceae and is characterized by its showy, cup-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in rocky habitats and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. It has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces a single flower per stem, which blooms in late spring to early summer. This variety is distinguished by its pale coloration and is often found in open areas with well-drained soil.
